page.title: 12 Employment
page.content: These statistics are for May 1985 and are based on a travel to work pattern. Whitstable has 90 job vacancies,(part time work included).The unemployment figures are 1029,(849 males & 380 females),an increase of 10 from April. The figures have remained steady for the past 4 years, but with Amphenol making 90 people redundant this balance will be upset. Tesco's Hyper- market opening in 1986 may restore the balance. The present unemployment figure averages at 12.5% which is the National average.Most advertised vacancies were for skilled workers and many were part time jobs.There were vacancies for catering,office and community workers.17 training courses were advertised in the Job Centre.Many local people work in small factories or service industries.A number commute to London and Canterbury.
